entry.key: Mica
entry.value: Mica

entry.key: ModelRocketKid1Hey, it’s you!
entry.value: Hey, it’s you!

entry.key: ModelRocketKid1Slate said you’re blasting off in your ship today. I’m really excited to see the launch!
entry.value: Slate said you’re blasting off in your ship today. I’m really excited to see the launch!

entry.key: ModelRocketKid1Aren’t you gonna go into space? Aren’t you? You better not have changed your mind!
entry.value: Aren’t you gonna go into space? Aren’t you? You better not have changed your mind!

entry.key: MicaModelRocketKid1Hey, I’m still going!
entry.value: Hey, I’m still going!

entry.key: MicaModelRocketKid1I want to practice with a pro before I leave.
entry.value: I want to practice with a pro before I leave.

entry.key: MicaModelRocketKid1I hear you and Slate beefed up the model ship. Can I see it?
entry.value: I hear you and Slate beefed up the model ship. Can I see it?

entry.key: ModelRocketKid5You better be! It’s been forever since anyone launched into space. I really, really want to see it.
entry.value: You better be! It’s been forever since anyone launched into space. I really, really want to see it.

entry.key: ModelRocketKid5Really bad.
entry.value: Really bad.

entry.key: ModelRocketKid5Hey, you want to try out my model ship? Slate says it’s just like the real thing, only less likely to start a fire.
entry.value: Hey, you want to try out my model ship? Slate says it’s just like the real thing, only less likely to start a fire.

entry.key: ModelRocketKid2Aww, you’re just saying that. ...But if you really want to practice with me, I guess I could help you out a little.
entry.value: Aww, you’re just saying that. ...But if you really want to practice with me, I guess I could help you out a little.

entry.key: ModelRocketKid3Yeah, we recalibrated the controls and installed better thrusters. Want to give it a test drive? Slate says it’s just like the real thing, only less likely to start a fire.
entry.value: Yeah, we recalibrated the controls and installed better thrusters. Want to give it a test drive? Slate says it’s just like the real thing, only less likely to start a fire.

entry.key: ModelRocketKid4Try to land on one of the <color=orange>geyser pools</color>. Show me what you’ve got!
entry.value: Try to land on one of the <color=orange>geyser pools</color>. Show me what you’ve got!

entry.key: FailureWow, that was just like the time the external fuel tanks exploded on reentry!
entry.value: Wow, that was just like the time the external fuel tanks exploded on reentry!

entry.key: FailureYou’ll... you’ll be okay flying the big one, right?
entry.value: You’ll... you’ll be okay flying the big one, right?

entry.key: SuccessWhat a landing! I guess that’s why Slate lets you fly the real thing, huh?
entry.value: What a landing! I guess that’s why Slate lets you fly the real thing, huh?

entry.key: ModelRocketKidSecondarySomeday, I want to design a ship that goes even faster than the ones Slate makes!
entry.value: Someday, I want to design a ship that goes even faster than the ones Slate makes!

entry.key: ModelRocketKidSecondarySlate says they think I can do it. And Gossan says I should ask Slate to be my first test pilot.
entry.value: Slate says they think I can do it. And Gossan says I should ask Slate to be my first test pilot.

entry.key: SignThis remarkably intact statue was carved by the Nomai, an ancient species who dwelled in our solar system thousands of years ago.
entry.value: This remarkably intact statue was carved by the Nomai, an ancient species who dwelled in our solar system thousands of years ago.

entry.key: SignThe statue provides us with our most detailed look yet at the Nomai, who appear to have been covered with a layer of fur. Note the decorative jewelry that has been carved as part of the antlers.
entry.value: The statue provides us with our most detailed look yet at the Nomai, who appear to have been covered with a layer of fur. Note the decorative jewelry that has been carved as part of the antlers.

entry.key: SignAlthough their artifacts and structures have been found on almost every planet in this solar system, we still have no idea where this species came from or what happened to them.
entry.value: Although their artifacts and structures have been found on almost every planet in this solar system, we still have no idea where this species came from or what happened to them.

entry.key: SignThis pilot seat, used by pioneering astronaut Feldspar, is all that remains of our inaugural flight into space.
entry.value: This pilot seat, used by pioneering astronaut Feldspar, is all that remains of our inaugural flight into space.

entry.key: SignAlthough it’s been argued such a distinction requires a breathtakingly liberal definition of flight, that day will nevertheless always be remembered as landmark achievement in Hearthian history.
entry.value: Although it’s been argued such a distinction requires a breathtakingly liberal definition of flight, that day will nevertheless always be remembered as a landmark achievement in Hearthian history.

entry.key: SignAside from the dwellings and structures they built, the Nomai also made art. This decorated pottery was discovered on Brittle Hollow.
entry.value: Aside from the dwellings and structures they built, the Nomai also made art. This decorated pottery was discovered on Brittle Hollow.

entry.key: SignSome ancient Nomai art depicts strange animals, foreign celestial objects, and other subjects that can’t be found in our solar system, which makes us wonder whether the Nomai originated elsewhere in the universe or simply had vibrant imaginations.
entry.value: Some ancient Nomai art depicts strange animals, foreign celestial objects, and other subjects that can’t be found in our solar system, which makes us wonder whether the Nomai originated elsewhere in the universe or simply had vibrant imaginations.

entry.key: SignWere the Nomai born in our solar system? Or were they born among other stars and planets - and if they were, how and why did they come here?
entry.value: Were the Nomai born in our solar system? Or were they born among other stars and planets - and if they were, how and why did they come here?

entry.key: SignThese are just some of the questions we hope to answer through further xenoarchaeological expeditions.
entry.value: These are just some of the questions we hope to answer through further xenoarchaeological expeditions.

entry.key: SignThe Nomai technology brought back from space by our astronauts has been a great boon to Outer Wilds Ventures, allowing us to modify expedition gear in exciting and useful ways.
entry.value: The Nomai technology brought back from space by our astronauts has been a great boon to Outer Wilds Ventures, allowing us to modify expedition gear in exciting and useful ways.

entry.key: SignFor example, the Little Scout now boasts a warp retrieval capability that allows astronauts to recall their scouts almost instantly. This has dramatically reduced the number of scouts lost to the depths of space.
entry.value: For example, the Little Scout now boasts a warp retrieval capability that allows astronauts to recall their scouts almost instantly. This has dramatically reduced the number of scouts lost to the depths of space.

entry.key: SignThe Nomai never got to see it for themselves, but thanks to their efforts and technology, a Hearthian was able to reach the Eye of the universe.
entry.value: The Nomai never got to see it for themselves, but thanks to their efforts and technology, a Hearthian was able to reach the Eye of the universe.

entry.key: SignThe strange rock moving around in this grotto appears to react to conscious observation.
entry.value: The strange rock moving around in this grotto appears to react to conscious observation.

entry.key: SignThe level-headed among us realize there must be some sort of optical illusion at play, but Gabbro claims the rock “exists in all possible states until it is observed” (whatever that means).
entry.value: The level-headed among us realize there must be some sort of optical illusion at play, but Gabbro claims the rock "exists in all possible states until it is observed" (whatever that means).

entry.key: SignWhatever is actually happening, both sides of this debate agree the effect is extremely creepy.
entry.value: Whatever is actually happening, both sides of this debate agree the effect is extremely creepy.

entry.key: Riebeck
entry.value: Riebeck

entry.key: Riebeck0Oh, you launched! That’s great. Great job, you.
entry.value: Oh, you launched! That’s great. Great job, you.

entry.key: Riebeck0Wow, I guess that means I’ve been out here a while, huh. Well, um, this is Brittle Hollow. But you probably knew that.
entry.value: Wow, I guess that means I’ve been out here a while, huh. Well, um, this is Brittle Hollow. But you probably knew that.

entry.key: Riebeck0Lot of history here. ...It’s great.
entry.value: Lot of history here. ...It’s great.

entry.key: RiebeckRiebeck0What are you doing here?
entry.value: What are you doing here?

entry.key: RiebeckRiebeck0I’m in a hurry — can I ask you something?
entry.value: I’m in a hurry — can I ask you something?

entry.key: RiebeckIntroI’m here to see the Hanging City. It’s always been my dream to see it with my own four eyes, ever since I was a hatchling.
entry.value: I’m here to see the Hanging City. It’s always been my dream to see it with my own four eyes, ever since I was a hatchling.

entry.key: RiebeckIntroAn alien race lived in this solar system long before our species even existed! How could I not want to see what their civilization was like?
entry.value: An alien race lived in this solar system long before our species even existed! How could I not want to see what their civilization was like?

entry.key: RiebeckIntroOnly...
entry.value: Only...

entry.key: RiebeckIntroYou’ve... probably heard the others say it, right? I’m afraid of space. Seriously, I’m more surprised than anybody that I’m out here.
entry.value: You’ve... probably heard the others say it, right? I’m afraid of space. Seriously, I’m more surprised than anybody that I’m out here.

entry.key: RiebeckIntroDo you want to know how I even got this far? I fell. Tripped over a gravity crystal. It’s dumb luck I landed somewhere my Little Scout says is halfway stable, instead of being sucked into... what’s below.
entry.value: Do you want to know how I even got this far? I fell. Tripped over a gravity crystal. It’s dumb luck I landed somewhere my Little Scout says is halfway stable, instead of being sucked into... what’s below.

entry.key: RiebeckIntroI’ve been gauging the stability of the ground around me using my Little Scout, and this seems to be the place with the best surface integrity, so I’m just going to stay here until I’m ready to move on.
entry.value: I’ve been gauging the stability of the ground around me using my Little Scout, and this seems to be the place with the best surface integrity, so I’m just going to stay here until I’m ready to move on.

entry.key: RiebeckIntro...But that’s enough about me and my problems. You didn’t come all this way to listen to me blather, did you! Heh, that’d be... yeah.
entry.value: ...But that’s enough about me and my problems. You didn’t come all this way to listen to me blather, did you! Heh, that’d be... yeah.

entry.key: Riebeck1Hi! ...What’s up?
entry.value: Hi! ...What’s up?

entry.key: RiebeckHurryToQuestionsUm, sure — of course! Anything you want.
entry.value: Um, sure — of course! Anything you want.

entry.key: Questions
RiebeckQuestionsI learned something!
entry.value: I learned something!

entry.key: RiebeckQuestionsWhere should I explore here?
entry.value: Where should I explore here?

entry.key: RiebeckQuestionsWhat are you doing out here?
entry.value: What are you doing out here?

entry.key: RiebeckQuestionsSee you later.
entry.value: See you later.

entry.key: RiebeckArcheologistMe? I’m an archeologist, remember?
entry.value: Me? I’m an archeologist, remember?

entry.key: RiebeckArcheologistOr, um, the archeologist, I guess. Seeing as I’m all Timber Hearth’s got right now.
entry.value: Or, um, the archeologist, I guess. Seeing as I’m all Timber Hearth’s got right now.

entry.key: RiebeckArcheologistBrittle Hollow is rich with Nomai history. That’s why I’m here. This planet is an absolute treasure trove of culture, history, and science.
entry.value: Brittle Hollow is rich with Nomai history. That’s why I’m here. This planet is an absolute treasure trove of culture, history, and science.

entry.key: RiebeckArcheologistIf you have any questions about the Brittle Hollow Nomai, I’m your Hearthian! Or, um... I have some knowledge of them, I mean. So. <size=20>Maybe I can help?</size>
entry.value: If you have any questions about the Brittle Hollow Nomai, I’m your Hearthian! Or, um... I have some knowledge of them, I mean. So. <size=20>Maybe I can help?</size>

entry.key: RiebeckExploreOh wow, where shouldn’t you explore here? Um, not the black hole, actually. That’s... very no.
entry.value: Oh wow, where shouldn’t you explore here? Um, not the black hole, actually. That’s... very no.

entry.key: RiebeckExploreWhich is unfortunate, because uh, the most exciting stuff is all below the crust. Including the <color=orange>Hanging City</color> — that’s just to the north. You can kinda see it from here.
entry.value: Which is unfortunate, because uh, the most exciting stuff is all below the crust. Including the <color=orange>Hanging City</color> — that’s just to the north. You can kinda see it from here.

entry.key: RiebeckExploreThere’s also this big dome on the south pole called the <color=orange>Southern Observatory</color>. You can’t get inside from the surface — trust me, I tried — but if it’s like the rest of the Nomai structures here, there’s probably a path to it beneath the crust somewhere.
entry.value: There’s also this big dome on the south pole called the <color=orange>Southern Observatory</color>. You can’t get inside from the surface — trust me, I tried — but if it’s like the rest of the Nomai structures here, there’s probably a path to it beneath the crust somewhere.

entry.key: RiebeckExploreGood luck with exploring. Um, if you learn anything about the Nomai, I’d love to hear it, <size=20>if it’s not too much trouble?</size>
entry.value: Good luck with exploring. Um, if you learn anything about the Nomai, I’d love to hear it, <size=20>if it’s not too much trouble?</size>

entry.key: RiebeckLearnedOh, cool! <Pause/>Um, what is it?
entry.value: Oh, cool! <Pause />Um, what is it?

entry.key: RiebeckRiebeckLearnedI found the Nomai escape pod on Brittle Hollow.
entry.value: I found the Nomai escape pod on Brittle Hollow.

entry.key: RiebeckRiebeckLearnedI found the Vessel!
entry.value: I found the Vessel!

entry.key: RiebeckRiebeckLearnedI saw the old settlement.
entry.value: I saw the old settlement.

entry.key: RiebeckRiebeckLearnedI saw the Hanging City on Brittle Hollow.
entry.value: I saw the Hanging City on Brittle Hollow.

entry.key: RiebeckRiebeckLearnedI saw the Sunless City on Ember Twin.
entry.value: I saw the Sunless City on Ember Twin.

entry.key: RiebeckRiebeckLearnedI found Nomai writing about a quantum pilgrimage.
entry.value: I found Nomai writing about a quantum pilgrimage.

entry.key: RiebeckRiebeckLearnedI went to the comet, and...
entry.value: I went to the comet, and...

entry.key: RiebeckRiebeckLearnedI TALKED TO A LIVING NOMAI!
entry.value: I TALKED TO A LIVING NOMAI!

entry.key: RiebeckRiebeckLearnedActually, nevermind.
entry.value: Actually, nevermind.

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_ExitOh, okay. If you do learn something new about the Nomai, though, I’d love to hear it! Um, if you don’t mind, I mean.
entry.value: Oh, okay. If you do find learn something new about the Nomai, though, I’d love to hear it! Um, if you don’t mind, I mean.

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_1Wow! So then, the Nomai probably came here from somewhere outside the solar system. And they must have been in trouble when they launched their escape pod... but what kind of trouble?
entry.value: Wow! So then, the Nomai probably came here from somewhere outside the solar system. And they must have been in trouble when they launched their escape pod... but what kind of trouble?

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_1And where did the escape pod launch from? I’m so curious!
entry.value: And where did the escape pod launch from? I’m so curious!

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_1This is an amazing discovery. I hope we can find out more about how and why the Nomai arrived here!
entry.value: This is an amazing discovery. I hope we can find out more about how and why the Nomai arrived here!

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_2You did?! That, that’s incredible, congratulations!
entry.value: You did?! That, that’s incredible, congratulations!

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_2That means they really were from far outside our solar system. Haha, yes! I knew it!
entry.value: That means they really were from far outside our solar system. Haha, yes! I knew it!

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_2But that creates so many new questions! If they didn’t come from our solar system, where did they come from? Are they from our galaxy, or somewhere even farther? What were their lives like before they came here? And why did they come here?
entry.value: But that creates so many new questions! If they didn’t come from our solar system, where did they come from? Are they from our galaxy, or somewhere even farther? What were their lives like before they came here? And why did they come here?

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_2Hey, I... I might not be much of an astronaut, but I’m really glad I came out here to see the Nomai’s artifacts for myself. And, um, thanks for telling me. <Pause/>About the Vessel, I mean.
entry.value: Hey, I... I might not be much of an astronaut, but I’m really glad I came out here to see the Nomai’s artifacts for myself. And, um, thanks for telling me. <Pause/>About the Vessel, I mean.

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_3Isn’t it amazing? Hard to believe the settlement is still standing, but there it is.
entry.value: Isn’t it amazing? Hard to believe the settlement is still standing, but there it is.

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_3It really makes you appreciate living somewhere like Timber Hearth. You know, somewhere that isn’t being constantly bombarded with meteors and rocks and stuff.
entry.value: It really makes you appreciate living somewhere like Timber Hearth. You know, somewhere that isn’t being constantly bombarded with meteors and rocks and stuff.

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_4You visited the Hanging City? Oh gosh, how was it? Was it amazing? Was it beautiful? ...Was it scary?
entry.value: You visited the Hanging City? Oh gosh, how was it? Was it amazing? Was it beautiful? ...Was it scary?

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_4The Hanging City is where the Nomai settled permanently on Brittle Hollow. It was their most advanced settlement here!
entry.value: The Hanging City is where the Nomai settled permanently on Brittle Hollow. It was their most advanced settlement here!

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_4Why they chose to build their most advanced settlement so close to a you-know-what is beyond me. Maybe that kind of thing makes sense to a Nomai, though. ...Maybe they needed the black hole for something?
entry.value: Why they chose to build their most advanced settlement so close to a you-know-what is beyond me. Maybe that kind of thing makes sense to a Nomai, though. ...Maybe they needed the black hole for something?

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_5You mean there’s another Nomai city inside of Ember Twin? That’s incredible! A whole city, and I had no idea it existed! This is great!
entry.value: You mean there’s another Nomai city inside of Ember Twin? That’s incredible! A whole city, and I had no idea it existed! This is great!

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_5How did they keep the sand out? If it were me, I’d be nervous about getting buried in the caves by that awful river of sand. Gosh, the Nomai sure were ingenius, building an entire settlement underground. The Sunless City! ...Wow!
entry.value: How did they keep the sand out? If it were me, I’d be nervous about getting buried in the caves by that awful river of sand. Gosh, the Nomai sure were ingenius, building an entire settlement underground. The Sunless City! ...Wow!

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_5That means there were two groups of Nomai — one that lived on Ember Twin, and one that lived here on Brittle Hollow. But they must have traveled around the solar system, since Nomai writing can be found on other planets, too.
entry.value: That means there were two groups of Nomai — one that lived on Ember Twin, and one that lived here on Brittle Hollow. But they must have traveled around the solar system, since Nomai writing can be found on other planets, too.

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_6A pilgrimage to the Quantum Moon? The Nomai mentioned the Quantum Moon in a lot of their writing, so it was clearly special to them. And um, special enough to make a trip there by themselves!
entry.value: A pilgrimage to the Quantum Moon? The Nomai mentioned the Quantum Moon in a lot of their writing, so it was clearly special to them. And um, special enough to make a trip there by themselves!

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_6It sounds like a coming-of-age ritual, like how hatchlings stay hatchlings until their stomachs are strong enough to drink sap wine.
entry.value: It sounds like a coming-of-age ritual, like how hatchlings stay hatchlings until their stomachs are strong enough to drink sap wine.

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_6Maybe once a Nomai journeyed to the Quantum Moon, they were considered an adult?
entry.value: Maybe once a Nomai journeyed to the Quantum Moon, they were considered an adult?

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_7Oh, wow. Wow. So that’s how the Nomai died?
entry.value: Oh, wow. Wow. So that’s how the Nomai died?

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_7That’s... really sad, isn’t it? I know it was a long time ago, but still...
entry.value: That’s... really sad, isn’t it? I know it was a long time ago, but still...

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_7Stars above, it’s lucky we hadn’t evolved to live on land yet.
entry.value: Stars above, it’s lucky we hadn’t evolved to live on land yet.

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_7To think, if the comet hadn’t killed them, our species might have coexisted in this solar system. That would have been amazing.
entry.value: To think, if the comet hadn’t killed them, our species might have coexisted in this solar system. That would have been amazing.

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_7But...
entry.value: But...

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_7I guess if I hadn’t wanted to learn why the Nomai disappeared, I’d never have left Timber Hearth and come out here, or had any of these adventures.
entry.value: I guess if I hadn’t wanted to learn why the Nomai disappeared, I’d never have left Timber Hearth and come out here, or had any of these adventures.

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_7...Don’t get me wrong, space is terrifying! But, you know, it has its moments.
entry.value: ...Don’t get me wrong, space is terrifying! But, you know, it has its moments.

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_8AHHH! That doesn’t make any sense! I don’t understand! I am very excited for you, though! P-please stop yelling!
entry.value: AHHH! That doesn’t make any sense! I don’t understand! I am very excited for you, though! P-please stop yelling!

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_8...What? On the Quantum Moon, you said?<Pause> There’s a sort of-living Nomai on the Quantum Moon?!
entry.value: ...What? On the Quantum Moon, you said?<Pause> There’s a sort of-living Nomai on the Quantum Moon?!

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_8WELL, WHY DIDN’T YOU SAY SO?!
entry.value: WELL, WHY DIDN’T YOU SAY SO?!

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_8Oh wow! Wow! This is the best thing that’s ever happened in the history of Outer Wilds Ventures! I can’t believe you talked to an actual Nomai!
entry.value: Oh wow! Wow! This is the best thing that’s ever happened in the history of Outer Wilds Ventures! I can’t believe you talked to an actual Nomai!

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_8Great! So I just have to go back into space, fly to the Quantum Moon with zero visibility, find a spooky ruin, and travel through a few different types of dangerous terrain to get there.
entry.value: Great! So I just have to go back into space, fly to the Quantum Moon with zero visibility, find a spooky ruin, and travel through a few different types of dangerous terrain to get there.

entry.key: RiebeckLearned_8Okay, yeah, that’s... that’s not so bad. <Pause><size=20>That’s probably doable...</size>
entry.value: Okay, yeah, that’s... that’s not so bad. <Pause><size=20>That’s probably doable...</size>

entry.key: SignThis piece of Nomai writing was essential to deciphering their unique language.
entry.value: This piece of Nomai writing was essential to deciphering their unique language.

entry.key: SignAlthough this text is linear, Nomai text often branches off from a central point. Interestingly, each branch tends to be written by a different author.
entry.value: Although this text is linear, Nomai text often branches off from a central point. Interestingly, each branch tends to be written by a different author.

entry.key: SignWhat you see here are parts of the Nomai skeleton. We can tell from their skulls that they possessed antlers and, quite unusually, only three eyes.
entry.value: What you see here are parts of the Nomai skeleton. We can tell from their skulls that they possessed antlers and, quite unusually, only three eyes.

entry.key: SignThe Nomai body was most likely adapted for living exclusively on land. The differences in the Nomai’s anatomy, such as their shockingly fragile bone structure, show us that Hearthians couldn’t have descended from Nomaian ancestors.
entry.value: The Nomai body was most likely adapted for living exclusively on land. The differences in the Nomai’s anatomy, such as their shockingly fragile bone structure, show us that Hearthians couldn’t have descended from Nomaian ancestors.

entry.key: SignIt’s not clear where the Nomai originated from, or why they disappeared. We hope to find more clues to this puzzle as we explore our solar system.
entry.value: It’s not clear where the Nomai originated from, or why they disappeared. We hope to find more clues to this puzzle as we explore our solar system.

entry.key: SignThe Nomai who came to our solar system were following a signal from the Eye of the universe.
entry.value: The Nomai who came to our solar system were following a signal from the Eye of the universe.

entry.key: SignThey perished when the Interloper arrived, bringing with it the deadly substance we called ghost matter that flooded the entire solar system almost instantly and without warning.
entry.value: They perished when the Interloper arrived, bringing with it the deadly substance we called ghost matter that flooded the entire solar system almost instantly and without warning.

entry.key: SignWe never figured out how they died.
entry.value: We never figured out how they died.

entry.key: SignStars like our sun generate light and heat by fusing hydrogen into helium.
entry.value: Stars like our sun generate light and heat by fusing hydrogen into helium.

entry.key: SignAs it grows older, the star runs out of hydrogen and starts to contract.
entry.value: As it grows older, the star runs out of hydrogen and starts to contract.

entry.key: SignAs the star’s core contracts, it gets hotter, causing the outer layers to expand. The star has become a red giant.
entry.value: As the star’s core contracts, it gets hotter, causing the outer layers to expand. The star has become a red giant.

entry.key: SignWhen the core is hot enough, it starts to fuse helium into carbon.
entry.value: When the core is hot enough, it starts to fuse helium into carbon.

entry.key: SignIf a star is massive enough, it will continue to fuse carbon into even heavier elements like iron.
entry.value: If a star is massive enough, it will continue to fuse carbon into even heavier elements like iron.

entry.key: SignUltimately, the star will collapse under its own gravity and then explode in a violent event called a supernova.
entry.value: Ultimately, the star will collapse under its own gravity and then explode in a violent event called a supernova.

entry.key: SignBased on Chert’s observations, this will one day be the fate of our own sun.
entry.value: Based on Chert's observations, this will one day be the fate of our own sun.

entry.key: SignAt the end of its lifespan, our sun collapsed under its own gravity and then exploded in a violent supernova.
entry.value: At the end of its lifespan, our sun collapsed under its own gravity and then exploded in a violent supernova.

entry.key: SignWatch closely... these balls move on their own!
entry.value: Watch closely... these balls move on their own!

entry.key: SignThe ground is perfectly level, so what do you think causes this spooky motion?
entry.value: The ground is perfectly level, so what do you think causes this spooky motion?

entry.key: SignThe answer is the moon! As it orbits our planet, the Attlerock’s gravity pulls on objects from different directions. In fact, it’s pulling on you right now!
entry.value: The answer is the moon! As it orbits our planet, the Attlerock’s gravity pulls on objects from different directions. In fact, it’s pulling on you right now!

entry.key: ROOT: I was hoping to deliver new ore data to Poke in her <color=orange>Black Hole Forge</color>, but the warp tower on the <color=orange>Twilight Twin</color> sent me to the wrong part of <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color>.
entry.value: ROOT: I was hoping to deliver new ore data to Poke in her <color=orange>Black Hole Forge</color>, but the warp tower on the <color=orange>Twilight Twin</color> sent me to the wrong part of <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color>.

entry.key: ROOT: Could someone kindly remind me if there’s a way to warp directly to the forge or if I imagined this?
entry.value: ROOT: Could someone kindly remind me if there’s a way to warp directly to the forge or if I imagined this?

entry.key: CLARY: There is! The <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color> warp tower that stands on the <color=orange>Twilight Twin</color> will take you to two different places, including the forge. Just make sure you start at the correct place within the tower.
entry.value: CLARY: There is! The <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color> warp tower that stands on the <color=orange>Twilight Twin</color> will take you to two different places, including the forge. Just make sure you start at the correct place within the tower.

entry.key: ROOT: Of personal note: Remember to give Clary my gratitude when next I visit the <color=orange>Black Hole Forge</color>.
entry.value: ROOT: Of personal note: Remember to give Clary my gratitude when next I visit the <color=orange>Black Hole Forge</color>.

entry.key: Black Hole Forge controls
entry.value: <color=orange>Black Hole Forge controls</color>

entry.key: POKE: Clary and Root, kindly tune the alignments on each black hole core as I finish them. The schematic on the floor shows which warp tower aligns with which astral body.
entry.value: POKE: Clary and Root, kindly tune the alignments on each black hole core as I finish them. The schematic on the floor shows which warp tower aligns with which astral body.

entry.key: CLARY: To speed future deliveries to <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>, I’ve tuned the first black hole core to activate when its warp tower aligns with <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color>.
entry.value: CLARY: To speed future deliveries to <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>, I’ve tuned the first black hole core to activate when its warp tower aligns with <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color>.

entry.key: CLARY: And before anyone comments, yes, I am aware this reduces the distance between Yarrow and me.
entry.value: CLARY: And before anyone comments, yes, I am aware this reduces the distance between Yarrow and me.

entry.key: ROOT: The schematic shows the six towers on <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color> are being tuned to only five alignments. Is that a mistake?
entry.value: ROOT: The schematic shows the six towers on <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color> are being tuned to only five alignments. Is that a mistake?

entry.key: POKE: No, that’s correct. For these alignments we've decided to treat the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins</color> as a single astral body.
entry.value: POKE: No, that’s correct. For these alignments we've decided to treat the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins</color> as a single astral body.

entry.key: POKE: Have you seen Phlox’s tower designs in the <color=orange>High Energy Lab</color> on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin</color>? They clarify each tower’s warp destination.
entry.value: POKE: Have you seen Phlox’s tower designs in the <color=orange>High Energy Lab</color> on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin</color>? They clarify each tower’s warp destination.

entry.key: POKE: If it helps, you can imagine the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins</color> as aligning with themselves.
entry.value: POKE: If it helps, you can imagine the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins</color> as aligning with themselves.

entry.key: THATCH: This knowledge is too dear to lose: Here is everything we can recall about the signal we encountered while aboard the <color=orange>Vessel</color>.
entry.value: THATCH: This knowledge is too dear to lose: Here is everything we can recall about the signal we encountered while aboard the <color=orange>Vessel</color>.

entry.key: FILIX: The signal looked like an eye: round, with a circle at the center much like a pupil. (Suppose the signal was looking for something.)
entry.value: FILIX: The signal looked like an eye: round, with a circle at the center much like a pupil. (Suppose the signal was looking for something.)

entry.key: FILIX: The signal was older than the universe itself! This is the most significant detail.
entry.value: FILIX: The signal was older than the universe itself! This is the most significant detail.

entry.key: PLUME: No Nomai clan has ever encountered anything like it! How can anything in this universe be older than the universe itself?
entry.value: PLUME: No Nomai clan has ever encountered anything like it! How can anything in this universe be older than the universe itself?

entry.key: THATCH: Imagine what rare and profound knowledge it might offer. We must find this Eye of the universe.
entry.value: THATCH: Imagine what rare and profound knowledge it might offer. We must find this Eye of the universe.

entry.key: The <color=orange>shuttle</color> is currently resting at the <color=lightblue>comet</color>.
entry.value: The <color=orange>shuttle</color> is currently resting at the <color=lightblue>comet</color>.

entry.key: Who’s been computing shuttle trajectories to the <color=orange>Sun Station</color>? Don’t worry; the station is in such a low stellar orbit, we’ve constructed a different, safer way to travel there from <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>.
entry.value: Who’s been computing shuttle trajectories to the <color=orange>Sun Station</color>? Don’t worry; the station is in such a low stellar orbit, we’ve constructed a different, safer way to travel there from <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>.

entry.key: IDAEA: That would be Pye. I told her we wouldn’t be traveling there by <color=orange>shuttle</color>, and that the <color=orange>Sun Station</color> doesn’t even have a landing pad, but she said she knew.
entry.value: IDAEA: That would be Pye. I told her we wouldn’t be traveling there by <color=orange>shuttle</color>, and that the <color=orange>Sun Station</color> doesn’t even have a landing pad, but she said she knew.

entry.key: PYE: It’s a purely theoretical exercise on my part, Yarrow. Who doesn’t love computing a good low stellar orbit shuttle trajectory!
entry.value: PYE: It’s a purely theoretical exercise on my part, Yarrow. Who doesn’t love computing a good low stellar orbit shuttle trajectory!

entry.key: IDAEA: Pye, I look forward to working with you, but I’m also relieved it will be easy to return to <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color> regularly.
entry.value: IDAEA: Pye, I look forward to working with you, but I’m also relieved it will be easy to return to <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color> regularly.

entry.key: MELORAE: This rock is very familiar! Did you travel here, my sedimentary friend? Because your unique color and texture appears identical to a rock I met earlier.
entry.value: MELORAE: This rock is very familiar! Did you travel here, my sedimentary friend? Because your unique color and texture appears identical to a rock I met earlier.

entry.key: MELORAE: Wasn’t this same rock fragment in the cave we found at the bottom of the dry lakebed (at the north pole)?
entry.value: MELORAE: Wasn’t this same rock fragment in the cave we found at the bottom of the dry lakebed (at the north pole)?

entry.key: COLEUS: An update: Melorae and I went back to the <color=orange>Lakebed Cave</color> and observed this rock again. Sometimes it’s there, and sometimes it isn’t.
entry.value: COLEUS: An update: Melorae and I went back to the <color=orange>Lakebed Cave</color> and observed this rock again. Sometimes it’s there, and sometimes it isn’t.

entry.key: MELORAE: That means this rock wanders like the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> does. How curious!
entry.value: MELORAE: That means this rock wanders like the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> does. How curious!

entry.key: COLEUS: We plan to reexamine the northern <color=orange>Lakebed Cave</color>. (Maybe our friendly rock will meet us down there!)
entry.value: COLEUS: We plan to reexamine the northern <color=orange>Lakebed Cave</color>. (Maybe our friendly rock will meet us down there!)

entry.key: <TimeMinutes> MINUTES, <TimeSeconds> SECONDS AGO: Long-range probe successfully launched from the <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color>.
entry.value: <TimeMinutes> MINUTES, <TimeSeconds> SECONDS AGO: Long-range probe successfully launched from the <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color>.

entry.key: We offer our congratulations! You’ve learned the rule of quantum imaging. Take this knowledge with you on the remainder of your quantum pilgrimage.
entry.value: We offer our congratulations! You’ve learned the rule of quantum imaging. Take this knowledge with you on the remainder of your quantum pilgrimage.

entry.key: Remember, the other quantum shards have other lessons to teach.
entry.value: Remember, the other quantum shards have other lessons to teach.

entry.key: Our curiosity goes with you on your journey. You walk in the footsteps of those who came before you, and your path guides those who will follow later.
entry.value: Our curiosity goes with you on your journey. You walk in the footsteps of those who came before you, and your path guides those who will follow later.

entry.key: PHLOX: Yarrow, would you kindly step back so Daz is closest to the statue? When pairing, the statue will choose whoever is in closest proximity.
entry.value: PHLOX: Yarrow, would you kindly step back so Daz is closest to the statue? When pairing, the statue will choose whoever is in closest proximity.

entry.key: PHLOX: ...See how its eyes have opened? That tells us the statue has paired with Daz. Now, no matter where he is in this star system, Daz’s statue will record his memories and send them to the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>.
entry.value: PHLOX: ...See how its eyes have opened? That tells us the statue has paired with Daz. Now, no matter where he is in this star system, Daz’s statue will record his memories and send them to the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>.

entry.key: YARROW: This is extraordinary sculpting work, Phlox!
entry.value: YARROW: This is extraordinary sculpting work, Phlox!

entry.key: DAZ: He has outdone himself again, hasn’t he? And now that we have our first successful pairing, we can test my memory storage prototype.
entry.value: DAZ: He has outdone himself again, hasn’t he? And now that we have our first successful pairing, we can test my memory storage prototype.

entry.key: DAZ: Each statue will send a single Nomai’s memories to his or her own storage unit within <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>.
entry.value: DAZ: Each statue will send a single Nomai’s memories to his or her own storage unit within <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>.

entry.key: PHLOX: Each storage unit will be equipped with a mask, the statue’s counterpart, which will be able to send those stored memories back to the corresponding Nomai.
entry.value: PHLOX: Each storage unit will be equipped with a mask, the statue’s counterpart, which will be able to send those stored memories back to the corresponding Nomai.

entry.key: <TimeMinutes> MINUTES, <TimeSeconds> SECONDS AGO: Request to launch probe received from <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>.
entry.value: <TimeMinutes> MINUTES, <TimeSeconds> SECONDS AGO: Request to launch probe received from <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>.

entry.key: Cannon aligned with randomly selected probe trajectory. Gravity field activated.
entry.value: Cannon aligned with randomly selected probe trajectory. Gravity field activated.

entry.key: Control Module
entry.value: <color=orange>Control Module</color>

entry.key: Launch Module
entry.value: <color=orange>Launch Module</color>

entry.key: Receiving data from probe <NbTimeloops>.
entry.value: Receiving data from probe <NbTimeloops>.

entry.key: Visualizing current trajectory of probe <NbTimeloops>.
entry.value: Visualizing current trajectory of probe <NbTimeloops>.

entry.key: SOLANUM: There is fundamental uncertainty throughout the universe. Normally, this uncertainty is only observable on a very small scale. As one approaches the Eye, however, that uncertainty grows enormously.
entry.value: SOLANUM: There is fundamental uncertainty throughout the universe. Normally, this uncertainty is only observable on a very small scale. As one approaches the Eye, however, that uncertainty grows enormously.

entry.key: SOLANUM: The <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> probably exhibits macroscopic quantum behavior because of its proximity to the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>. Shards that broke off from the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> have a similar effect, as I imagine you’ve seen elsewhere in this star system.
entry.value: SOLANUM: The <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> probably exhibits macroscopic quantum behavior because of its proximity to the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>. Shards that broke off from the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> have a similar effect, as I imagine you’ve seen elsewhere in this star system.

entry.key: SOLANUM: Conscious observation forces a quantum object to collapse to a single possibility. But what would happen if a conscious observer somehow entered the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> itself?
entry.value: SOLANUM: Conscious observation forces a quantum object to collapse to a single possibility. But what would happen if a conscious observer somehow entered the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> itself?

entry.key: SOLANUM: Over time, this has become my clan’s greatest question.
entry.value: SOLANUM: Over time, this has become my clan’s greatest question.

entry.key: SOLANUM: I imagine your purpose here is the same as mine: to learn about and to find the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color>.
entry.value: SOLANUM: I imagine your purpose here is the same as mine: to learn about and to find the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color>.

entry.key: SOLANUM: I’m unsure how you arrived here, however. Perhaps you came from another star system, as my clan originally did?
entry.value: SOLANUM: I’m unsure how you arrived here, however. Perhaps you came from another star system, as my clan originally did?

entry.key: SOLANUM: Have you encountered a quantum shard on another planet? The shards look the same as the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>’s surface does now, while at the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>.
entry.value: SOLANUM: Have you encountered a quantum shard on another planet? The shards look the same as the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>’s surface does now, while at the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>.

entry.key: SOLANUM: From this, we can reasonably infer the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>’s natural state is as we see it now, and that the Eye is its primary location.
entry.value: SOLANUM: From this, we can reasonably infer the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>’s natural state is as we see it now, and that the Eye is its primary location.

entry.key: SOLANUM: Given the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> is the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s moon, it’s likely that any characteristics the moon exhibits are also exhibited by the Eye itself. The <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> and its shards, for instance, are quantum; thus, the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is likely also quantum.
entry.value: SOLANUM: Given the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> is the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s moon, it’s likely that any characteristics the moon exhibits are also exhibited by the Eye itself. The <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> and its shards, for instance, are quantum; thus, the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is likely also quantum.

entry.key: SOLANUM: In fact, this moon is probably quantum because its proximity to the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> made it quantum, the same way the areas surrounding quantum shards that landed on other planets eventually became quantum, too.
entry.value: SOLANUM: In fact, this moon is probably quantum because its proximity to the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> made it quantum, the same way the areas surrounding quantum shards that landed on other planets eventually became quantum, too.

entry.key: SOLANUM: I am on my first pilgrimage to the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>. All Nomai in my clan make this journey when we come of age.
entry.value: SOLANUM: I am on my first pilgrimage to the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>. All Nomai in my clan make this journey when we come of age.

entry.key: SOLANUM: Even though the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> cannot be reached from here, the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> remains special to us, as it carries us nearer to the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> than any other place we know.
entry.value: SOLANUM: Even though the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> cannot be reached from here, the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> remains special to us, as it carries us nearer to the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> than any other place we know.

entry.key: SOLANUM: I’ve journeyed here to be close to the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>. While the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is obscured from our sight, we can see the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>’s reflection of the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> in the sky above us.
entry.value: SOLANUM: I’ve journeyed here to be close to the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>. While the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is obscured from our sight, we can see the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>’s reflection of the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> in the sky above us.

entry.key: SOLANUM: Suppose you could reach the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color>: Would you try to enter it?
entry.value: SOLANUM: Suppose you could reach the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color>: Would you try to enter it?

entry.key: SOLANUM: What do you imagine the effects of a conscious observer might be?
entry.value: SOLANUM: What do you imagine the effects of a conscious observer might be?

entry.key: SOLANUM: I imagine you’ve noticed the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> changes in appearance depending on which location it is currently orbiting (for instance, the moon looks quite different when orbiting <color=lightblue>Giant’s Deep</color> than it does when orbiting the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins</color>).
entry.value: SOLANUM: I imagine you’ve noticed the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> changes in appearance depending on which location it is currently orbiting (for instance, the moon looks quite different when orbiting <color=lightblue>Giant's Deep</color> than it does when orbiting the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins</color>).

entry.key: SOLANUM: Because the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> clearly changes in its different forms, the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> (being this moon’s primary location) must be similarly malleable.
entry.value: SOLANUM: Because the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> clearly changes in its different forms, the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> (being this moon’s primary location) must be similarly malleable.

entry.key: SOLANUM: From this, we can hypothesize that the Eye represents extreme changeability.
entry.value: SOLANUM: From this, we can hypothesize that the Eye represents extreme changeability.

entry.key: SOLANUM: That said, despite its malleable nature, the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> becomes locked to one specific version of itself when it is consciously observed.
entry.value: SOLANUM: That said, despite its malleable nature, the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> becomes locked to one specific version of itself when it is consciously observed.

entry.key: SOLANUM: But what would happen if a conscious observer were to enter the Eye?
entry.value: SOLANUM: But what would happen if a conscious observer were to enter the Eye?

entry.key: SOLANUM: Many in my clan have believed the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> called to us for a particular purpose.
entry.value: SOLANUM: Many in my clan have believed the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> called to us for a particular purpose.

entry.key: SOLANUM: When I was a child, I used to believe the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> was malevolent, to have lured my clan to this star system only to then vanish from them so completely.
entry.value: SOLANUM: When I was a child, I used to believe the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> was malevolent, to have lured my clan to this star system only to then vanish from them so completely.

entry.key: SOLANUM: But I don’t fear the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>, anymore. In fact, it became my fondest hope to see the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> itself, someday, but I fear this may be beyond my reach.
entry.value: SOLANUM: But I don’t fear the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>, anymore. In fact, it became my fondest hope to see the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> itself, someday, but I fear this may be beyond my reach.

entry.key: SOLANUM: You may think I’m strange, but I have a hypothesis that I may not be entirely alive. Perhaps my journey has reached its end.
entry.value: SOLANUM: You may think I’m strange, but I have a hypothesis that I may not be entirely alive. Perhaps my journey has reached its end.

entry.key: SOLANUM: These are the two tenets of Nomai philosophy; to seek out and to understand is our way of living.
entry.value: SOLANUM: These are the two tenets of Nomai philosophy; to seek out and to understand is our way of living.

entry.key: SOLANUM: We are orbiting the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color> now, although we cannot see it (only the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>’s reflection of it). The <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is older than the universe itself, and my clan believes it dwells in an extremely distant orbit around this star system.
entry.value: SOLANUM: We are orbiting the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color> now, although we cannot see it (only the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>’s reflection of it). The <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is older than the universe itself, and my clan believes it dwells in an extremely distant orbit around this star system.

entry.key: SOLANUM: I’ve never met one of your kind before. It’s an honor to speak with you! I particularly admire your four eyes.
entry.value: SOLANUM: I’ve never met one of your kind before. It’s an honor to speak with you! I particularly admire your four eyes.

entry.key: SOLANUM: There are many questions I would ask, if I could comprehend your language. You have my gratitude for understanding mine.
entry.value: SOLANUM: There are many questions I would ask, if I could comprehend your language. You have my gratitude for understanding mine.

entry.key: SOLANUM: This is the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>, where we both are standing.
entry.value: SOLANUM: This is the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>, where we both are standing.

entry.key: SOLANUM: Despite also orbiting other celestial bodies, the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> is the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color>’s moon.
entry.value: SOLANUM: Despite also orbiting other celestial bodies, the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> is the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color>’s moon.

entry.key: SOLANUM: I am Solanum, a Nomai. My clan arrived in this star system before my birth, and we now call it home.
entry.value: SOLANUM: I am Solanum, a Nomai. My clan arrived in this star system before my birth, and we now call it home.

entry.key: SOLANUM: Is this your first time on the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>? It’s my first time here.
entry.value: SOLANUM: Is this your first time on the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>? It’s my first time here.

entry.key: SOLANUM: If you’ve come here looking for answers, I hope you find them.
entry.value: SOLANUM: If you’ve come here looking for answers, I hope you find them.

entry.key: SOLANUM: Like many of my clan before me, I journeyed here to see the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>’s reflection of the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>. This is the closest any of us have come to seeing the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> itself.
entry.value: SOLANUM: Like many of my clan before me, I journeyed here to see the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>’s reflection of the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>. This is the closest any of us have come to seeing the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> itself.

entry.key: SOLANUM: We do not have much connection, you and I.
entry.value: SOLANUM: We do not have much connection, you and I.

entry.key: SOLANUM: Still, this encounter feels special. I hope you won’t mind if I think of you as a friend.
entry.value: SOLANUM: Still, this encounter feels special. I hope you won’t mind if I think of you as a friend.

entry.key: RAMIE: I’ve installed the masks inside the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>, Phlox. They look beautiful (although I do feel as though I’m being observed!).
entry.value: RAMIE: I’ve installed the masks inside the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>, Phlox. They look beautiful (although I do feel as though I’m being observed!).

entry.key: RAMIE: It’s comforting to know the statues will not pair until the project succeeds. Otherwise, I imagine the experience would be hard to endure!
entry.value: RAMIE: It’s comforting to know the statues will not pair until the project succeeds. Otherwise, I imagine the experience would be hard to endure!

entry.key: PHLOX: Ideally, they’ll only need to activate once the project succeeds; as a safety measure, however, the statues will also activate in the event of equipment failure.
entry.value: PHLOX: Ideally, they’ll only need to activate once the project succeeds; as a safety measure, however, the statues will also activate in the event of equipment failure.

entry.key: RAMIE: They will? Why is that?
entry.value: RAMIE: They will? Why is that?

entry.key: PHLOX: If anything goes wrong with the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>, the statues (and their masks) will make us aware of the situation and enable us to fix it. Otherwise, it would be possible for us to remain permanently unaware of the problem.
entry.value: PHLOX: If anything goes wrong with the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>, the statues (and their masks) will make us aware of the situation and enable us to fix it. Otherwise, it would be possible for us to remain permanently unaware of the problem.

entry.key: RAMIE: I hadn’t thought of that! What a profoundly horrific fate that would be.
entry.value: RAMIE: I hadn’t thought of that! What a profoundly horrific fate that would be.

entry.key: ROOT: Friends in the <color=orange>Timber Hearth Mines</color>, the last type of ore you sent us survives the longest in direct heat.
entry.value: ROOT: Friends in the <color=orange>Timber Hearth Mines</color>, the last type of ore you sent us survives the longest in direct heat.

entry.key: ROOT: Can you send us more of the same for additional testing? We’re attempting to improve its durability, and our forge has already burned through everything you sent!
entry.value: ROOT: Can you send us more of the same for additional testing? We’re attempting to improve its durability, and our forge has already burned through everything you sent!

entry.key: OENO: We’ll deliver more ore to <color=lightblue>Hollow’s Lantern</color> immediately. You must be fired up about crafting the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>’s protective shell!
entry.value: OENO: We’ll deliver more ore to <color=lightblue>Hollow’s Lantern</color> immediately. You must be fired up about crafting the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>’s protective shell!

entry.key: ROOT: Yes, the idea of an encasement that’s supernova-proof, however briefly, has kindled my curiosity!
entry.value: ROOT: Yes, the idea of an encasement that’s supernova-proof, however briefly, has kindled my curiosity!

entry.key: ROOT: My gratitude! I imagine we’ll also have an updated estimate soon of how much ore is needed to seal off the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>.
entry.value: ROOT: My gratitude! I imagine we’ll also have an updated estimate soon of how much ore is needed to seal off the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>.

entry.key: OENO: Will it be more than we initially thought?
entry.value: OENO: Will it be more than we initially thought?

entry.key: ROOT: It will be significantly more. The smallest crack or opening in the protective shell would destroy everything.
entry.value: ROOT: It will be significantly more. The smallest crack or opening in the protective shell would destroy everything.

entry.key: Solanum
entry.value: Solanum

entry.key: SolanumNomai1Who are you?
entry.value: Who are you?

entry.key: SolanumNomai1Where are we?
entry.value: Where are we?

entry.key: 281,042 YEARS AGO: No user commands received for 10 minutes. All systems entering sleep.
entry.value: 281,042 YEARS AGO: No user commands received for 10 minutes. All systems entering sleep.

entry.key: <TimeMinutes> MINUTES, <TimeSeconds> SECONDS AGO: Increased solar activity detected. <color=orange>Sun Station</color> hull integrity approaching critical levels. Closing emergency doors.
entry.value: <TimeMinutes> MINUTES, <TimeSeconds> SECONDS AGO: Increased solar activity detected. <color=orange>Sun Station</color> hull integrity approaching critical levels. Closing emergency doors.

entry.key: <TimeMinutes> MINUTES, <TimeSeconds> SECONDS AGO: Received data from previous cycles.
entry.value: <TimeMinutes> MINUTES, <TimeSeconds> SECONDS AGO: Received data from previous cycles.

entry.key: MASKS RECEIVING DATA FROM:\\n<color=orange>Probe Tracking Module</color>\\n<color=lightblue>Giant’s Deep</color> memory statue\\n<color=lightblue>Timber Hearth</color> memory statue
entry.value: MASKS RECEIVING DATA FROM:\\n<color=orange>Probe Tracking Module</color>\\n<color=lightblue>Giant's Deep</color> memory statue\\n<color=lightblue>Timber Hearth</color> memory statue

entry.key: YARROW: Some time has passed since I checked in with you, Pye. How are you and Idaea progressing with the <color=orange>Sun Station</color> plans?
entry.value: YARROW: Some time has passed since I checked in with you, Pye. How are you and Idaea progressing with the <color=orange>Sun Station</color> plans?

entry.key: PYE: Presently, my assessment is that our plan will either fail explosively or succeed explosively.
entry.value: PYE: Presently, my assessment is that our plan will either fail explosively or succeed explosively.

entry.key: IDAEA: Pye, you know I don’t find that funny.
entry.value: IDAEA: Pye, you know I don’t find that funny.

entry.key: PYE: How curious; Ramie thinks I’m a gas. And I don’t recall requesting that you monitor this conversation, Idaea.
entry.value: PYE: How curious; Ramie thinks I’m a gas. And I don’t recall requesting that you monitor this conversation, Idaea.

entry.key: IDAEA: I don’t see what state of matter you are has to do with this. And I don’t recall supporting the <color=orange>Sun Station</color>’s construction, but here we are.
entry.value: IDAEA: I don’t see what state of matter you are has to do with this. And I don’t recall supporting the <color=orange>Sun Station</color>’s construction, but here we are.

entry.key: YARROW: Hypothesis: Time spent away from the station would be beneficial to you both.
entry.value: YARROW: Hypothesis: Time spent away from the station would be beneficial to you both.

entry.key: PYE: I’m immensely interested in testing your hypothesis, Yarrow.
entry.value: PYE: I’m immensely interested in testing your hypothesis, Yarrow.

entry.key: IDAEA: That, at least, we can agree on.
entry.value: IDAEA: That, at least, we can agree on.

entry.key: Chert
entry.value: Chert

entry.key: ChertIntro1Goodness, it’s you! Hello! I take it your first launch went well, then? Welcome to the Hourglass Twins. <Pause=2>Mind the sand, now.
entry.value: Goodness, it’s you! Hello! I take it your first launch went well, then? Welcome to the Hourglass Twins. <Pause=2>Mind the sand, now.

entry.key: ChertChertIntro1I have a question for you.
entry.value: I have a question for you.

entry.key: ChertChertIntro1What are you up to?
entry.value: What are you up to?

entry.key: ChertIntroExplanationHornfels asked me to update our star charts, so I’m out here observing. This is one of the best places in the solar system to spot astronomical events, you know.
entry.value: Hornfels asked me to update our star charts, so I’m out here observing. This is one of the best places in the solar system to spot astronomical events, you know.

entry.key: ChertIntroExplanationWhat’s weird is I’ve actually seen a couple of supernovae today. Usually, I’d be fortunate to see just one. Keep an eye or four on the stars, and maybe you’ll spot one yourself!
entry.value: What’s weird is I’ve actually seen a couple of supernovae today. Usually, I’d be fortunate to see just one. Keep an eye or four on the stars, and maybe you’ll spot one yourself!

entry.key: QuestionsTell me, what can I do for you?
entry.value: Tell me, what can I do for you?

entry.key: ChertQuestionsI found something!
entry.value: I found something!

entry.key: ChertQuestionsHow do I know if I've spotted a supernova?
entry.value: How do I know if I've spotted a supernova?

entry.key: ChertQuestionsWhat are you doing out here?
entry.value: What are you doing out here?

entry.key: ChertQuestionsWhere should I explore here?
entry.value: Where should I explore here?

entry.key: ChertQuestionsHow dangerous is that big column of falling sand?
entry.value: How dangerous is that big column of falling sand?

entry.key: ChertQuestionsJust saying hi.
entry.value: Just saying hi.

entry.key: Chert1Right now I’m documenting stars. Hornfels noticed our star charts are out of date, so they asked me to update them.
entry.value: Right now I’m documenting stars. Hornfels noticed our star charts are out of date, so they asked me to update them.

entry.key: Chert1Please don’t tell the others I said this, but sometimes I think I’m the only traveler out here interested in doing any science at all.
entry.value: Please don’t tell the others I said this, but sometimes I think I’m the only traveler out here interested in doing any science at all.

entry.key: Chert1...Er, maybe don’t tell Hornfels, either. I think they’re pretty deep in denial.
entry.value: ...Er, maybe don’t tell Hornfels, either. I think they’re pretty deep in denial.

entry.key: Chert2To be honest, I haven’t left this lakebed. I don’t mean to brag, but I’m really quite good with the Little Scout, so I’ve been taking pictures of everything from right here in my campsite.
entry.value: To be honest, I haven’t left this lakebed. I don’t mean to brag, but I’m really quite good with the Little Scout, so I’ve been taking pictures of everything from right here in my campsite.

entry.key: Chert2Have you seen the old shipwreck site on Ember Twin’s southern hemisphere, the one shooting a bright beam of light into the sky? It’s not one of our own crashes, surprisingly enough - this one’s a Nomai ship.
entry.value: Have you seen the old shipwreck site on Ember Twin’s southern hemisphere, the one shooting a bright beam of light into the sky? It’s not one of our own crashes, surprisingly enough - this one’s a Nomai ship.

entry.key: Chert2You’ll find Nomai ruins across the Twins, but, strangely, not a single settlement! Believe me, if there was one to see, I’d have seen it with my Little Scout.
entry.value: You’ll find Nomai ruins across the Twins, but, strangely, not a single settlement! Believe me, if there was one to see, I’d have seen it with my Little Scout.

entry.key: Chert2So where did they live? Not on the surface, clearly. Ember Twin is full of cave systems, though - maybe the answer lies underground?
entry.value: So where did they live? Not on the surface, clearly. Ember Twin is full of cave systems, though - maybe the answer lies underground?

entry.key: Chert3On a scale of one to dead, I’d give it a seven or eight. Awfully pretty, though.
entry.value: On a scale of one to dead, I’d give it a seven or eight. Awfully pretty, though.

entry.key: Chert3Right now sand is flowing from Ash Twin to Ember Twin, but did you know the process eventually reverses? We're not completely sure why the sand flows back and forth between the Twins, but it seems to be a natural phenomena.
entry.value: Right now sand is flowing from Ash Twin to Ember Twin, but did you know the process eventually reverses? We're not completely sure why the sand flows back and forth between the Twins, but it seems to be a natural phenomena.

entry.key: Chert3Oh, if you’d like to see something interesting, check out the other Twin once a little more of its sand drains off. I promise you won’t be disappointed.
entry.value: Oh, if you’d like to see something interesting, check out the other Twin once a little more of its sand drains off. I promise you won’t be disappointed.

entry.key: Chert4Supernovae look like extra bright stars to the naked eye, but if you zoom in with your signalscope you can tell that they're actually enormous explosions.
entry.value: Supernovae look like extra bright stars to the naked eye, but if you zoom in with your signalscope you can tell that they're actually enormous explosions.

entry.key: Chert4Massive stars go supernova at the very end of their life spans, which is why it's so unusual to see two in a single day.
entry.value: Massive stars go supernova at the very end of their life spans, which is why it's so unusual to see two in a single day.

entry.key: Chert4I wonder if some of these stars are older than we realized?
entry.value: I wonder if some of these stars are older than we realized?

entry.key: Chert5Watch out for falling sand, okay? I’ve had to dig myself out once or twice, and that’s not half as fun as it sounds.
entry.value: Watch out for falling sand, okay? I’ve had to dig myself out once or twice, and that’s not half as fun as it sounds.

entry.key: ChertSecondaryHello again!
entry.value: Hello again!

entry.key: FoundSomethingMenuPlease, do tell!
entry.value: Please, do tell!

entry.key: ChertFoundSomethingMenuI found out the sun is about to go supernova.
entry.value: I found out the sun is about to go supernova.

entry.key: ChertFoundSomethingMenuI found your notes about the Attlerock’s main crater.
entry.value: I found your notes about the Attlerock’s main crater.

entry.key: ChertFoundSomethingMenuI found Nomai writing about a hidden planet.
entry.value: I found Nomai writing about a hidden planet.

entry.key: ChertFoundSomethingMenuI found Nomai writing about the Quantum Moon.
entry.value: I found Nomai writing about the Quantum Moon.

entry.key: ChertFoundSomethingMenuI found Nomai writing about the Sun Station.
entry.value: I found Nomai writing about the Sun Station.

entry.key: ChertFoundSomethingMenuI found modern Nomai transmissions saying the universe is dying.
entry.value: I found modern Nomai transmissions saying the universe is dying.

entry.key: ChertFoundSomethingMenuActually, nevermind.
entry.value: Actually, nevermind.

entry.key: FoundSomething1What? What makes you think that?
entry.value: What? What makes you think that?

entry.key: FoundSomething1It’s true the sun has... changed, lately, but I’ve not seen any evidence suggesting the approaching death of our sun! Stars above, no!
entry.value: It’s true the sun has... changed, lately, but I’ve not seen any evidence suggesting the approaching death of our sun! Stars above, no!

entry.key: FoundSomething1I’ll tell you what, though - I’ll keep my eyes on the sun, and if I find any suggestion the its core is collapsing, you shall be the first to know.
entry.value: I’ll tell you what, though - I’ll keep my eyes on the sun, and if I find any suggestion the its core is collapsing, you shall be the first to know.

entry.key: FoundSomething1I hope that puts your mind at ease.
entry.value: I hope that puts your mind at ease.

entry.key: FoundSomething2Did you! I hope they were useful?
entry.value: Did you! I hope they were useful?

entry.key: FoundSomething2The planet I mentioned may have been frozen solid, or just partially made of ice, like a much colder Giant’s Deep - it’s hard to say. It used to be the fifth planet in our solar system.
entry.value: The planet I mentioned may have been frozen solid, or just partially made of ice, like a much colder Giant’s Deep - it’s hard to say. It used to be the fifth planet in our solar system.

entry.key: FoundSomething2You’ll notice, of course, that there’s no such planet now. In its place is Dark Bramble, which - how to put this - grew into the space the fifth planet used to occupy.
entry.value: You’ll notice, of course, that there’s no such planet now. In its place is Dark Bramble, which - how to put this - grew into the space the fifth planet used to occupy.

entry.key: FoundSomething2That is, Dark Bramble quite literally appeared at the center of the fifth planet and began destroying it from the inside-out. Eventually, the planet shattered completely, and its shards were flung across space.
entry.value: That is, Dark Bramble quite literally appeared at the center of the fifth planet and began destroying it from the inside-out. Eventually, the planet shattered completely, and its shards were flung across space.

entry.key: FoundSomething2Some of these shards collided with the celestial bodies in our solar system, such as the Attlerock, which I believe is how its biggest crater was formed.
entry.value: Some of these shards collided with the celestial bodies in our solar system, such as the Attlerock, which I believe is how its biggest crater was formed.

entry.key: FoundSomething3How fascinating! It might interest you to know the existence of an additional planet is entirely plausible, if you look at the physics of our solar system. It would just have to be incredibly far out there - farther than Hearthian ships would be able to travel.
entry.value: How fascinating! It might interest you to know the existence of an additional planet is entirely plausible, if you look at the physics of our solar system. It would just have to be incredibly far out there - farther than Hearthian ships would be able to travel.

entry.key: FoundSomething3And honestly, we don’t know all that much about what’s out there. The farther you go, the less we know! As such, it’s well within the realm of possibility such a planet exists.
entry.value: And honestly, we don’t know all that much about what’s out there. The farther you go, the less we know! As such, it’s well within the realm of possibility such a planet exists.

entry.key: FoundSomething4Oh yes, everyone loves a good mystery, don’t they? Who wouldn’t wonder about a moon that’s sometimes there and sometimes not!
entry.value: Oh yes, everyone loves a good mystery, don’t they? Who wouldn’t wonder about a moon that’s sometimes there and sometimes not!

entry.key: FoundSomething4I’ve observed the Quantum Moon orbiting each of the five planets, but sometimes, it quite simply disappears from the sky altogether. Maybe there’s another place it travels to!
entry.value: I’ve observed the Quantum Moon orbiting each of the five planets, but sometimes, it quite simply disappears from the sky altogether. Maybe there’s another place it travels to!

entry.key: FoundSomething4Unfortunately, if there is, I’ve never seen it. Perhaps if I take a closer look at these star charts...
entry.value: Unfortunately, if there is, I’ve never seen it. Perhaps if I take a closer look at these star charts...

entry.key: FoundSomething5Is that what’s in orbit around the sun, then, do you think? This... Sun Station?
entry.value: Is that what’s in orbit around the sun, then, do you think? This... Sun Station?

entry.key: FoundSomething5Quite clever of the Nomai to devise a way to study the sun up close and personal! It must have been tremendously difficult to construct. ...And hot inside. I can only imagine!
entry.value: Quite clever of the Nomai to devise a way to study the sun up close and personal! It must have been tremendously difficult to construct. ...And hot inside. I can only imagine!

entry.key: FoundSomething5I wonder how were they able to travel back and forth from the Sun Station and the Hourglass Twins, when the slightest slip up would have meant a fiery death.
entry.value: I wonder how were they able to travel back and forth from the Sun Station and the Hourglass Twins, when the slightest slip up would have meant a fiery death.

entry.key: FoundSomething6You - what? I don’t... um. What?
entry.value: You - what? I don’t... um. What?

entry.key: FoundSomething6You mean to say there are modern Nomai out in other parts of space? And they believe the universe - all of it, the whole thing - is dying? <Pause/>Currently? <Pause/>...Right now?
entry.value: You mean to say there are modern Nomai out in other parts of space? And they believe the universe - all of it, the whole thing - is dying? <Pause/>Currently? <Pause/>...Right now?

entry.key: FoundSomething6If... if that’s true, how could I have missed so many signs? The supernovae were there, but I, but, I’ve been studying the stars for... well, what does it matter if... oh...
entry.value: If... if that’s true, how could I have missed so many signs? The supernovae were there, but I, but, I’ve been studying the stars for... well, what does it matter if... oh...

entry.key: FoundSomething6I’m very sorry, b-but I have to look over my charts. I h-h-hope you don’t m-mind...
entry.value: I’m very sorry, b-but I have to look over my charts. I h-h-hope you don’t m-mind...

entry.key: ChertBreakdownNomaiB-b-but surely, I would have seen some kind of other sign than the supernovae, so p-perhaps...?
entry.value: B-b-but surely, I would have seen some kind of other sign than the supernovae, so p-perhaps...?

entry.key: FoundSomething7Nothing you’d like to discuss at the moment? That’s no trouble! If you do discover anything you want to talk about, I’d be happy to help!
entry.value: Nothing you’d like to discuss at the moment? That’s no trouble! If you do discover anything you want to talk about, I’d be happy to help!

entry.key: ChertIntro1Hm? Oh, it’s you! I take it your first launch went well, then? Welcome to the Hourglass Twins. <Pause=2>Mind the sand, now.
entry.value: Hm? Oh, it’s you! I take it your first launch went well, then? Welcome to the Hourglass Twins. <Pause=2>Mind the sand, now.

entry.value: Hornfels noticed our star charts are out of date, so I came out here to update them. But something seems... <Pause=0.5>how to put this... <Pause=0.5>off.

entry.key: ChertIntroExplanationI’ve seen, what, ten supernovae by now? Twelve? They’re in the double digits now, and that’s, you know, not normal. Not normal at all...
entry.value: I’ve seen, what, ten supernovae by now? Twelve? They’re in the double digits now, and that’s, you know, not normal. Not normal at all...

entry.key: ChertIntro2Hm? Oh, you’re back.
entry.value: Hm? Oh, you’re back.

entry.key: ChertIntro2Say, have you noticed anything unusual about the stars lately? Something seems...<Pause=0.5> how to put this... <Pause=0.5>off.
entry.value: Say, have you noticed anything unusual about the stars lately? Something seems...<Pause=0.5> how to put this... <Pause=0.5>off.

entry.value: Was there something you needed?

entry.key: ChertQuestionsWhy are so many stars going supernovae?
entry.value: Why are so many stars going supernovae?

entry.key: Chert1Well, I was - that is, I originally came out here to update our star charts. Now, though, I’m trying to figure out what’s going on with the stars. There are so many - too many supernovae.
entry.value: Well, I was - that is, I originally came out here to update our star charts. Now, though, I’m trying to figure out what’s going on with the stars. There are so many - too many supernovae.

entry.key: Chert4I have no idea! Massive stars go supernova when they reach the end of their life spans, so it's possible that the stars are older than we realized. Or maybe our models are wrong and they don't live as long as we expected.
entry.value: I have no idea! Massive stars go supernova when they reach the end of their life spans, so it's possible that the stars are older than we realized. Or maybe our models are wrong and they don't live as long as we expected.

entry.key: Chert4Honestly, I'm not fond of either option! If our charts are wrong, what else is wrong? And our sun...
